results.title: The Meldrum Tapes: Best Of
results.brief_description: The program “The Meldrum Tapes” has given Australian audiences an opportunity to see another side of their favourite performers, in informal discussions, with Ian “Molly” Meldrum. This video shows Molly talking to the Rolling Stones, Genesis, Madonna, Elton John, Bob Geldof, Icehouse, The Models, Sting, Billy Joel, Cyndi Lauper and the Eurythmics.

results.title: The Melbourne Juvenile Justice Centre
results.brief_description: The Melbourne Juvenile Justice Centre was opened in December 1993 and replaced the outdated and inadequate Turana Youth Training Centre. It introduced a new approach to accomodating and rehabilitating young offenders completing sentences from the Victorian Court. This program shows efforts to break the circuit of offending by Client Service Planning and a strong emphasis on educational and vocational programs.

results.title: The Meeting place
results.creator_credit: Catherine Duncan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The town of Nuriootpa - an aboriginal word meaning “the meeting place” - lies in the rich Barossa valley in South Australia, about fifty miles from Adelaide. Although superficially Nuriootpa may appear to be much like any other Australian country town, it is in fact a place where co-operation and collective effort have won for the community many facilities which most country towns lack. Acting through a community committee consisting of representee of the residents of Nuriootpa, a hotel and a co-operative store have been established a technical school and youth centre opened, a swimming pool and a health centre built, and plans for future development drawn up.

results.title: The Meeting
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Morten Parker and John Howe
results.brief_description: A discussion film designed to raise questions about how much support an elected group should be entitled to expect from its electorate. At a meeting of a community group, a committee, delegated to choose a play to be staged, makes its choice known. A split occurs when some disagree and it seems that the committee may be overruled.

results.title: The Medium is the massage, you know
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Joseph Koenig and Trevor Greenwood
results.brief_description: The medium, of course, is television, and those massaged are the vast viewing audience. But this 1969 film is not an enquiry into the effects of television on the viewer, although there are some expressions of opinion in man-on-the-street interviews. For the most part, the film takes place in a Vancouver classroom where young students are given the facilities (camera, TV monitor, videotape recorder) to stage their own little act for the television screen. What they do reveals the impact that television has had on them.

results.title: The Medieval mind
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: An introduction to the unique character of the ‘medieval mind’. The film explains how medieval thought was fraught with tension and conflict and contrasts its world view with that of more recent times. Some of the conflicts within the Church are discussed and come medieval art, architecture and iconography is surveyed.

results.title: The Medieval crusades
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Milan Herzog
results.brief_description: Uses animation, live action, and recreated settings in discussing the causes of the crusades, their influence on European life, and the events and achievements of the first four crusades. Dramatises the adventures of two young knights who accompany the first crusade to Jerusalem in the last years of the eleventh century. Filmed in Southern France and the Holy Land.

results.title: The Medicine bottle
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: An inadvertent mistake with potentially disastrous consequences is made when Mrs Ross leaves the wrong medicine in the hands of her young daughter who is at home looking Mrs Ross’ bed-ridden mother. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Adele DeGarde, Marion Leonard, Linda Arvidson. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Media between us
results.brief_description: A film record of the 1968 Summer Research Institute of Screen Study, a joint project of the National Film Board and McGill University. Thirty teachers from across Canada attending a six-week course in film production and analysis are observed by a documentary film crew. Many of their discussions centre on the impact of technology and media on the individual and the environment.

results.title: The Mechanism of Life
results.creator_credit: Sakura Motion Pictures, Eiji Murayama and Masami Sugiyama
results.brief_description: Shows how biochemists study cellular life. Experiments are shown to support the theory of evolution of life from the four elements, carbon, hydrogen, oxygen and nitrogen. The methods used to study muscle protein and insulin are also shown.
